optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When a creature you can see makes a melee attack against you, you may use a reaction to gain a +2 to your AC until the end of the creature's turn. You must be wielding a simple or martial weapon and a dagger to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Perilous Blows
entries: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to strike with extra lethality in exchange for opening up your own defense. Doing so means your melee weapon attack rolls during this turn also score a critical hit on a d20 roll of 1 lower than usual (for example on a 19 or 20, rather than just a 20), but attack rolls against you share the same benefit until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Versatile Fighting
entries: While wielding a single versatile weapon and no shield, you can choose to wield your weapon one or two-handed until the start of your next turn. When wielding it one-handed you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and to your Armor class. Wielding it two-handed you gain a +2 bonus to your damage rolls.

race.name: Human Redux
entries: {@i Written by: @honeycombm}

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Fast Learners
entries: You gain proficiencies in any two skills, or tools of your choice. (you may also mix and match, eg: 1 skill and 1 tool)

entries.name: Indomitable human spirit.
entries: Once per long rest, if you are bloodied (Reduced to below half your hit point maximum) or take damage while bloodied, you may immediately use your reaction to roll a d12 plus your constitution modifier and gain that many hit points.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: Humans are a varied lot. Choose one of the following options for your character:

items.name: Athletic
items.entry: You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill, and your movement speed increases by 5ft.

items.name: Ingenious
items.entry: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for that cantrip (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Martial Prodigy
items.entry: You gain proficiency in light armor, shields, and two simple or martial weapons of your choice.

race.name: Ithovine
entries: {@i Written by: @corronnicolla}

entries.name: Ancestral Legacy
entries: If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it. If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in Intimidation and one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

entries.name: Regenerating Form
entries: Your body is laced with regenerative potential, manifesting in the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to your Armour Class, as your constantly regenerating body is harder to wound.

Once per long rest, when you start your turn while bloodied, you can push your regeneration to its limits. At the start of each of your turns while this ability is active, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus and can repeat a saving throw against any effect that would allow you to make a saving throw against it at the end of your turn. You cannot heal yourself above half your hit points with this feature. This burst of regenerative energy lasts for one minute or until you are incapacitated.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

race.name: Gnoll
entries: {@i Written by: @maplecrepe}

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Laughing Curse
entries: Your speech is interspersed with cackling laughter. As a bonus action, you may choose to give into the curse, giving you advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks, but disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Performance) for 1 minute.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnoll.

race.name: Dragon Tortle
entries: {@i Written by: @mitt_exists}

entries.name: Claws
entries: You have claws that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your shell provides you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can't wear light, medium, or heavy armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

entries.name: Aquatic Affinity
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Steam Breath
entries: You have the ability to exhale scalding breath. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 fire damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. Being underwater does not grant resistance to this damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

race.name: Dollkin
entries: {@i Written by: @dndhater}

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common as well as one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Armored Casing
entries: You are encased in thin metal or some other durable material. While you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries: When you are required to make an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, you can add 1d4 to it. If you choose to do this, it does not stack with other spells or magical resistance effects (this includes bless, magical resistance and resistance).

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you remain conscious.

entries.name: Unique Construction
entries: Opportunity attacks made against you are rolled with disadvantage.

entries.name: Artful Taste
entries: You gain proficiency in Performance.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points on your turn, you may use your bonus action to move up to your movement speed and make a Bite attack against a creature within your reach. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Strong Jaws
entries: Your bite deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of 1d4.

entries.name: Tough Hide
entries: Your AC when you aren’t wearing armor is equal to 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Haunted Magic
entries: You learn a {@filter cantrip of your choice from the Bard spell list.|spells|level=0|class=Bard} Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for this (choose when you select this subrace). When you reach 3rd level, you can cast a 1st-level spell from the Necromancy or Illusion schools of magic (choose a single spell when you reach this level) with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 1st level or higher.

entries.name: Cursed Jaws
entries: When you score a critical hit with your Bite or a melee spell attack, you can regain your use of your Haunted Magic 1st-level spell, or regain a first-level spell slot. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, your Bite is considered to be a melee weapon worth at least 1 gp for the purposes of spell components.

subrace.name: Variant Goliath
entries: {@i Written by: @mitt_exists}

entries.name: Stone Throw
entries: You can draw on the strength of giants and channel it into destructive force. When you take the Attack action on your turn you may replace one of the attacks and hurl a boulder through the air. You throw a mass of earth up to 60 feet to a point you can see. Creatures within a 5 cube centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or take 1d10 bludgeoning damage. Taking half as much on a success. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You must have a hand free to use this trait and you can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. If you have a feature that would make your unarmed attacks magical, this attack becomes magical too.

classFluff.name: Lictor
entries: {@i This Class was written by @brandonno.2}

entries.name: The Lictor
entries: A broad-shouldered woman in a long coat stands at a grave, seeing for the first time the withered flowers that were lain there for her long ago. Those she was stolen from now lie in graves of their own nearby. Slowly, she shuffles out through the gates. As she passes the caretaker, he starts in shock before mumbling an apology: taken aback by the grisly wound that will never close upon her face. A translucent gnomish teen drifts between the walls and through the doors of an empty house. Though she is no longer tethered to this place, she is not yet sure where she ought to go. She hides in the rafters as a group of newly assembled adventurers, tasked to investigate the local hauntings, approach the house. Perhaps, instead of playing tricks this time, she could ask them what to do...

Pale even for an elf, a slim man watches the streets of a damp city from the lip of a rooftop. He eyes the setting sun with trepidation. At last, he hears the shout of his prey. Leaping into the alley below, he interrupts the robbery with shocking strength, tossing thugs away from their intended victim. The poor child's screams risk attracting the attention of other things of the night, so the man calms him with an enchanting gaze before sending him off home. He does not linger, lest his sire come sniffing for recompense. Each of these individuals is a lictor, a being that was once risen to serve another as an undead. But where most such beings remain bound as slaves from death until destruction, a lictor has grasped hold of a rare opportunity to escape their chains and reclaim their soul.

entries.name: The Emancipated Dead
entries: To be a lictor means more than having become undead. In their remaking by a necromancer or other powerful force, these beings were granted the office of some form of greater horror: possessed of uncanny intellect, strength, or other useful attributes to be enhanced in the service of their new master. But what truly sets a lictor apart is that they have escaped their bondage.

Through some strange circumstance and sheer force of will, a lictor has managed to rediscover and rekindle a spark of their humanity. Their very souls, as real and alive as any other, have returned and reclaimed their cursed bodies. Why exactly this has happened is hard to say: perhaps they had an encounter with a higher celestial, or an artifact of unknown magic. Perhaps a vestige of their old self had always remained, only to be awoken by a mission that clashed with their past. The chance to be unstitched from the bonds of necromantic thraldom is the stuff of miracles. And even when presented with such an opportunity, not every soul can champion their own struggle for liberty from under such tragic circumstances — nor can every will weather all the trials a new life will hold for them after freedom is won.

Every lictor's soul is humanoid: subject to all the same emotions, magics, and variations as any other living being. No longer must they be counted among the vile ranks of undeath. But each lictor still bears with them the marks of their office. They stand out from a crowd, and they are likely to suffer its fear.

However, by combining their refound humanity with the dark powers now ingrained in them, they each have a chance for redemption and vindication. A lictor refuses to be defined by what was done to them. Their new life is a constant quest to find out who they were before, and, indeed, who they are now and wish to be.

classFeature.name: Accursed Office
entries: {@i 1st-level Lictor Feature}

The manner of your undeath left you equipped for specific duties beyond the grave. Choose the office that your are equipped for, Your choice grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 11th, 15th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: {@i 1st-level Lictor Feature}
You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Necrotic Engine
entries: {@i 2nd-level Lictor Feature}
You are now kept alive - after a fashion - by the necromantic magic that turns within you. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

The energy of nearby death also refuels your ongoing quest for vindication. You have three Necrotic Charges. You can never have more Necrotic charges than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent Necrotic Charges when you finish a long rest. Additionally, you gain a charge whenever a creature of size Small or larger within 30ft of you dies, and in the other way determined by your office at 3rd level.
On your turn while you are not incapacitated, you can use Necrotic Charges in the following ways:

items: Necrotic Shell: You expend one or more necrotic charges as a bonus action, gaining 2d4 temporary hit points plus an additional die for each additional charge.
Deathly Strike: You expend one necrotic charge when you successfully hit with a melee attack, dealing an additional 2d4 necrotic damage.

entries: This temporary HP / damage increases to 2d6 at 6th level, 2d8 at 10th level, and 2d10 at 15th level.
The maximum number of charges your Necrotic Engine can hold increases as you gain levels in this class: up to 4 charges at 5th level, 5 charges at 11th level, and 6 charges at 17th level.

classFeature.name: Soul Survivor
entries: {@i 2nd-level Lictor Feature}

The fact that your mind and morality have endured the process of becoming undead is a testament to your resolve, unwilling to bend. You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would cause you to be charmed or frightened.

classFeature.name: Accursed Office Feature
entries: {@i 3rd-level Lictor Feature}
Your Accursed Office grants you two Features at this level

classFeature.name: Wrack Foes
entries: {@i 3rd-level Lictor Feature}

You gain the ability to extend the foul powers that fuel you, temporarily, using that energy to inflict various woes upon your enemies. You can create two such effects: Wrack With Pain and an effect determined by your office. Once per turn when you take the Attack action on your turn, you can expend a Necrotic Charge to replace one of the attacks with a use of this feature. When you do so, you choose which effect to create out of those available to you. The Save DC of your Wrack Foes is:

entries.name: Wrack With Pain
entries: You extend the agony of undeath to enemies around you. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take necrotic damage equal to 2d6 + your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
Additionally, creatures that fail this save have disadvantage on their next concentration saving throw.
Additionally, creatures that fail the save by 5 or more cannot benefit from resistance to necrotic damage for 1 minute.
This feature's damage increases to 2d8 + PROF at 6th level, 2d10 + PROF at 10th level, and 2d12 + PROF at 15th level.
Additionally, at 18th level this feature ignores resistance to necrotic damage, and treats immunity to necrotic damage as resistance.

classFeature.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: {@i 3rd-level Lictor Feature}

By virtue of your exhumed nature, you are able to ignore some attacks that would fell living peers. When using medium armour, you may use your Constitution modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier for calculating your AC, still up to the maximum the armour allows.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level Lictor Feature}

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 5th-level Lictor Feature}
You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Past Knowledge
entries: {@i 5th-level Lictor Feature}

You died. You got better. Regardless of the circumstances of your resurrection, you were laid to rest and awoke in a world removed from your own. Whether it be a distance of years or centuries, you've got access to knowledge from a dead time.

Pick two skills or tool proficiencies that require intelligence. You become proficient in them if you are not already, and gain the ability to use your constitution in place of intelligence for those skills.

classFeature.name: Accursed Office Feature
entries: {@i 6th-level Lictor Feature}
Your Accursed Office grants you a Feature at this level

classFeature.name: Unrelenting Animus
entries: {@i 7th-level Lictor Feature}

Your restless body no longer feels the effects of decay, and you cannot be aged magically. Additionally, the first time you gain a level of exhaustion, you may ignore it. This ability resets on a short rest.

Moreover, when you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend a Necrotic Charge to sustain your body with a surge of magic. If you do so, you are not knocked unconscious. You still must make death saving throws as normal, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until this effect expires. While under this effect, you cannot gain any necrotic charges. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn, and may be extended by expending more charges.
When you reach level 14, you can gain necrotic charges while under the effect of Necrotic Animus.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 8th-level Lictor Feature}

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Revenant Tenacity
entries: {@i 9th-level Lictor Feature}

Your exhumed nature makes you easier to bring back from beyond the veil of death. If you are targeted by a spell such as Revivify, with sole effect of restoring you to life after dying, the caster does not need material components.

Additionally, you are a valid target for these types of spells for up to an additional hour after your death. Furthermore, you are able to expend your withered vitality to more swiftly recover. When you are healed or stabilised while at 0 hit points, you may expend an amount of hit die equal to your proficiency bonus and regain that much HP, becoming conscious in the process.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 13th level, you can use it twice before a long rest.

classFeature.name: Reduced Reliquary
entries: {@i 9th-level Lictor Feature}
Even a small part of you is infused with the pallor of death, which is handy in a pinch.
As a bonus action, you can harmlessly remove a part of yourself (e.g a nail, tooth, lock of hair, small bone). This reliquary is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest.
While the reliquary is imbued this way, you can give it one of these features:

items: You can spend an action to see and hear from the reliquary, blinding and deafening yourself until you dismiss the viewing or until 1 minute passes.
Someone holding the reliquary can cast Thaumaturgy, Prestidigitation or Druidcraft centred on the reliquary.
A creature holding the reliquary can understand and speak a language of your choice that you know.

entries: Once you create a token using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Inexorable March
entries: {@i 10th-level Lictor Feature}

Whenever a creature of size small or larger within 30 feet of you is reduced to below half of its hit point maximum for the first time since its last long rest, you become aware of this fact, and your necrotic engine gains a charge.

classFeature.name: Dead Tough
entries: {@i 11th-level Lictor Feature}
As a reaction to a saving throw being imposed on you, you may spend a necrotic charge and add your constitution modifier to the roll. This occurs before you roll.

classFeature.name: Accursed Office Feature
entries: {@i 11th-level Lictor Feature}
Your Accursed Office grants you a Feature at this level

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 12th-level Lictor Feature}

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Revenant Tenacity (two uses)
entries: {@i 13th-level Lictor Feature}
You can use Revenant Tenacity's ability to expend hit die to heal after being healed or stabilised at 0 hit points twice between long rests.

classFeature.name: Vindication
entries: {@i 14th-level Lictor Feature}
Although nothing has come easy, you have reclaimed some of your old identity through immense work. You gain one of the following benefits of your choice as befitting your former life.

items: You learn one {@filter 1st-level spell from any spell list|spells|level=1|class=druid;ranger;sorcerer;wizard;artificer;bard;warlock;cleric;paladin;monk}. This spell when you use it uses Charisma for its Save DC and Spell Attack rolls, and you can cast it once per short rest.
You learn an additional {@filter Fighting Style of your choice from those available to the Fighter, Paladin, or Ranger classes.|optionalfeatures|feature type=fs:f;fs:r;fs:p}

You learn one language and gain one proficiency in one skill of your choice. Additionally, pick one skill you are proficient in. When you make an ability check using the chosen skill, you can roll 1d4 and add the result to the check.

classFeature.name: Accursed Office Feature
entries: {@i 15th-level Lictor Feature}
Your Accursed Office grants you a Feature at this level

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 16th-level Lictor Feature}

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Eternal Animus
entries: {@i 17th-level Lictor Feature}
You cannot be killed instantly by massive damage, or have your body altered or destroyed by effects that would do so after reducing you to 0 hit points.

classFeature.name: Accursed Office Feature
entries: {@i 18th-level Lictor Feature}
Your Accursed Office grants you a Feature at this level

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 19th-level Lictor Feature}

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Become Death
entries: {@i 20th-level Lictor Feature}
You are now immune to necrotic and poison damage. In addition, whenever you roll initiative, your Necrotic Engine's charges are set to their maximum amount.

subclassFeature.name: Office of the Apparition
entries: Bound to this plane as a ghost, specter, wraith, or similar incorporeal being, you are a manifestation of raw emotional scarring. Whatever force enabled this shadow of your afterlife to linger on most likely fed on these feelings - of grief, anger, or perhaps envy - until it seemed like that was all you were.

Your mind may now be more your own, but your body remains forever lost. You move through your renewed life as an insubstantial form, but still determined to leave those that have crossed you feeling the keen edge of your conviction.

subclassFeature.name: Incorporeal Form
entries: You can move through other creatures as if they were difficult terrain, and creatures gain no benefit from half-cover or shields against your melee attack rolls.

At the start of your turn, you can become incorporeal, able to move through objects of size Large or smaller, including doors or windows but not solid walls. You can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses upon completing a short rest. You take 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object or creature and are shunted to the nearest safe empty space.

subclassFeature.name: The Old Haunt
entries: As an Apparition you may disperse your spectral self to view another area, haunting the surroundings. You can spend one minute concentrating on an object or creature within 100 feet of you that you are familiar with, and on completion you begin haunting the object/creature. While haunting, your are blind to your own senses, but gain the following benefits:

items: You can see and hear through a point above the object/creature haunted.
You can speak from a point within 30ft of the object/creature at any volume ranging from faint whispers to thunderous shouts, either from one location within it or several simultaneously.
You can move objects within it other than the object/creature you are haunting as if by the mage hand cantrip as an action. This version of the hand can carry/move up to 10 x Lictor level pounds.
You can end your haunting as an action. You cannot begin haunting another object/creature while haunting anobject/creature.

subclassFeature.name: Wrack Foes: Wrack with Grief
entries: You unleash an awful wail of raw emotion that washes over your enemies. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you have their movement speed reduced by 5ft until the end of their next turn, and must make a Wisdom saving throw or take 2d6 psychic damage. If they fail their movement speed is instead reduced by 10ft, and if they fail by 5 or more they also fall prone and cannot get up until the end of their next turn.
This feature's damage increases to 2d8 at 6th level, 2d10 at 10th level, and 2d12 at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consumption of Misfortune
entries: You gain an additional way to regain Necrotic Charges:
Once per round, whenever a creature you can see rolls a 1 or 2 on a D20, you can gain a Necrotic Charge.

subclassFeature.name: Geist's Waltz
entries: When you move through a creature, you can cause that creature to take 1d8+PROF cold damage. This ability is usable PROF times per round, and cannot be used against the same creature more than once per round.
This damage increases to 2d8 at 11th level, and 3d8 at 15th level.
Additionally, you do not provoke opportunity attacks and your speed increases by 10ft

subclassFeature.name: Phantasmal Killer
entries: You become swifter in inflicting your raison d'être on your foes. You can use Wrack with Grief as a bonus action, still paying the Necrotic Charge. When you do so, you can expend an additional Necrotic Charge to gain the base benefits of a Necrotic Shell.

In addition, you can extend your incorporeal form to others: as an action, you can touch a willing creature and expend a use of Incorporeal Form, allowing it to benefit from that feature until the start of your next turn. If a creature sharing this benefit ends its turn inside an object, it is immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space outside of the object, taking 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet it was shunted.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Passage
entries: You are able to tap into your ethereal nature, shifting between the ethereal and material plane at will. As a bonus action, you may loosen your connection to your current plane of existence for 1 minute. As part of this action and as a bonus action on subsequent turns while under this effect, you may vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane.
While in the Ethereal plane you may use a bonus action to return to an unoccupied space in the plane you originated from corresponding to your position in the Ethereal plane.
While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.
This ability may be used once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Absolute
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items: Creatures you have damaged with Geist's Waltz have their AC reduced by 2 until the start of your next turn, and you gain 5ft of movement after using Geist's Waltz.
Your Apparition features ignore resistance to pyschic and cold damage, and treat immunity to psychic and cold damage as resistance.
You add an additional 1d6 necrotic or psychic (your choice) damage to damage rolls against a creature that has taken damage from Geist's Waltz this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Office of the Death Knight
entries: Skeletal warriors clad in darkly-wrought metal, death knights rank among the most dangerous and frightful of undead forces. And the fault of their fall is invariably their own. A death knight is usually formed from a paladin who committed a tragic sin and never sought redemption - living instead a life of hatred that was only amplified in undeath. Wicked wights or dullahans may also be counted among these officers, having retained their personalities and penchant for violence through appealing to a dark power upon their death. These knights serve as commanders of fiendish or undead legions, leading slash-and-burn sieges and devastating cavalry charges. As a lictor of this office, you have lost none of your martial prowess, but you have realized at long last how desperately you must find your way again. Having secured your mortal soul, you are free of the purgatory of a death knight's relentless campaigning; but the quest for ultimate atonement will be long and arduous yet, should you accept it.

subclassFeature.name: Condemned Armory
entries: Yours is the office of war, and you have armed accordingly for your cursed crusade. You gain proficiency with heavy armor.
Additionally, your office has impressed upon you the importance of inflicting dread on your foes. You gain the ability to cast {@spell Thaumaturgy}.

subclassFeature.name: Pile on Woes
entries: You bear a dark likeness of a paladin's power. You have a pool of negative energy equal to 5 x your lictor level that replenishes when you take a long rest.
After dealing damage to a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can draw energy from the pool up to the amount of damage done and gain temporary Hit Points equal to the amount of points expended.

subclassFeature.name: Wrack Foes: Wrack with Hellfire
entries: You release a revelation of dark flame that explodes around you. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6+PROF fire damage and reduces their AC by 2 until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't reduce their AC. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more, you treat results of 1 or 2 on the damage die as a 3.
This feature's damage increases to 2d8 at 6th level, 2d10 at 10th level, and 2d12 at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consumption of Wrath
entries: You gain an additional way to regain Necrotic Charges:
Once per round, Whenever a creature within 30ft of you beats someone's AC by 5 or more, you can gain a necrotic charge.

subclassFeature.name: Command Macabre
entries: You have lost none of the gravitas in your grave commands. You are immune to being frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action you may command a willing allied creature within 30ft of you to do one of the following:

items: Move: The creature expends their reaction to move up to half their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Reinforce: The creature expends their reaction to gain the benefits of half cover until the start of their next turn.
Hold the line: until the start of your next turn, the creature can use their reaction to make an opportunity attack against an enemy that comes within their reach.

entries: This ability may be used an amount of times equal to twice your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wield Death
entries: As a death knight, the powers of death hone your edge. Your weapon attacks deal an additional 1d8 fire or necrotic damage (your choice).
Additionally, the first time each combat you spend your last Necrotic Charge, you immediately gain 2 back.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Vulnerability
entries: You may channel your undead energy into an aura of menace, inverting a Paladin's aegis. You may expend two Necrotic Charges as an action to create an aura with a 30ft radius centered on yourself, lasting for 1 minute. Whenever creatures of your choice roll a 1 or 2 on a damage roll they make for a weapon attack, they can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if it is a 1 or a 2.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Commander
entries: You have reached the apex of undead command. Your various abilities gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wrack Foes and weapon attacks ignore resistance to necrotic and fire damage, and treat immunity as resistance.
Whenever you use Command Macabre, you can target up to three creatures at a time using the one bonus action.
Your Aura of Vulnerability also applies to attack rolls. You gain a second Extra Attack.

subclassFeature.name: Office of the Tomb Guardian
entries: Perhaps you were a servant, a slave... or even a being of influence who was punished or usurped. Whatever the case, you were transformed after your death and bound to guard a place of great importance to your creators. You've retained the fierce protective powers and urges that once fueled chilling tales for grave-robbers and dungeoneers. Now, however, you guard what is yours by choice.

Lictors originating from this office are most likely to be mummies or similar undead. Very rarely, a being such as a flesh golem might coalesce something of a consciousness enough to become a lictor of this kind, but such personalities are likely to be simplistic or fractured. Despite their new liberty, tomb guardians of any origin are prone to paranoia, as if, despite all they have achieved, part of their original curse still drives them.

subclassFeature.name: Empty Flesh
entries: Removed or replaced organs have left precious little for a thief's dagger to puncture when you come upon them in the dark. You gain resistance to piercing damage and darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision from your race, its range increases by 30 feet. In addition, you can extend your withering energies as an action to instantly molder or evaporate up to 1 cubic foot of food or water that you touch. Other nonmagical drinks are spoiled — wine turning to vinegar, for instance.

subclassFeature.name: Forgive no Trespass
entries: On any creature's turn other than your own, the reach of your melee attacks is increased by 5 feet. If you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, its remaining movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.
The amount you reduce the movement speed of your target by increases as you gain levels in this class; up to 15 feet at 11th level, and up to 20 feet at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Wrack Foes: Wrack with Regret
entries: You utter a curse of doom upon those that transgress against you. hostile creatures within 10ft of you must make a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d6 force damage and cannot take movement that would move them more than 30ft away from you until the end of your next turn. If they fail the save by 5 or more, whenever they attack one of your allies they take 1d6 force damage for the same duration. This feature's damage increases to 1d8 at 6th level, 1d10 at 10th level, and 1d12 at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consumption of Greed
entries: You gain another way to regain Necrotic Charges:
Once per round, whenever you deal damage to a creature not on your turn whilst within 30ft of them, you can gain a necrotic charge.

subclassFeature.name: Immuring Mark
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to mark the target with sapping magic to prevent its escape. The target is marked for 1 minute. The mark ends early if you use this feature again. Until the effect ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: Once per round, you can make an opportunity attack against the marked target without using your reaction.
You can make opportunity attacks against the target if it moves while within the reach of your melee attacks, even if that movement does not take it out of your reach.

If the marked creature tries to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower, its magic is disrupted. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Wrack Save DC. On a failed save, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage per level of the spell, the spell fails and has no effect. The creature may still make another action that isn't casting a spell. On a success, the creature is able to cast the spell as normal.

entries: You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a Necrotic Charge to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Thief's Curse
entries: Those who would take what you guard must reckon with an abjuring curse. When a divination spell is cast on a target within 60 feet of you, you become aware of it and can use your reaction to cause it to fail or provide misleading results.

Alternatively, when a creature you can see picks up or moves an object you can see, you can use your reaction to curse the creature. Until the object is dropped or returned to its place, the cursed target subtracts 1d6 from all saving throws. This curse lasts for 1 minute, or until you use this feature on another target.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses upon completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dispersing Passage
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically transform into a whirlwind of dust, insects, salt, or sand and move up to 60 feet before reverting to your normal form. While in whirlwind form, you are immune to all damage, can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned, and you can pass freely through the space of other creatures. A creature whose space you pass through in whirlwind form must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Wrack Save DC or become blinded until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again, unless you expend two Necrotic Charges to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendant Psychopomp
entries: You have reached the apex of your office, becoming the ultimate guardian of those laid to rest. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have an additional reaction.
Creatures of your choice within 20ft of you have advantage on Wisdom and Intelligence saving throws. You deal an additional die of weapon damage on successful opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Office of the Tribute
entries: When you were taken, your body was given over completely to the seeds of undeath. Hollowed out by shadows, worms, or viral strains that carried the curse, you were then tasked with spreading it and gathering yet more bodies to your master's cause. Powerful evils such as Orcus or Kyuss are known to employ these wretched methods in their missions to see undeath victorious over the ashes of all worlds. Souls trapped within tributed bodies often remain aware of their fate and their unwitting actions, causing most to seek refuge in madness. It is a powerful soul, or a scarred one, that manages to pull themselves free of this station to seek something of a life.... or just a balm to their undeserved guilt.

subclassFeature.name: Harbinger of Doom
entries: Your imbuement of deathly energies grants you a unique connection to the dead. Once per short rest, you can cast Detect Evil and Good or Augury without a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Withering Aura
entries: As a bonus action, you can allow the death incubating inside your body to exude outwards in an aura that extends 10 feet from you in all directions, or withdraw it again. Any creature other than you that ends its turn in the aura takes 1d4+PROF necrotic, poison or piercing (your choice) damage. This aura retracts when you take another bonus action to do so, or when you fall unconscious.
The damage dealt by your aura increases when you reach certain levels in this class: 2d4+PROF at 6th level, 3d4+PROF at 11th level, 4d4+PROF at 15th level, and 5d4+PROF at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Wrack Foes: Wrack with Corruption
entries: You regurgitate the evils within you towards nearby enemies. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become corrupted for 1 minute. A corrupted target takes 1d6+PROF necrotic, piercing, or poison damage (your choice) at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to end this effect. A creature that fails its save by 5 or more becomes vulnerable to the damage it takes from this Wrack, and its creature type becomes undead for the duration of the corruption as your curse begins to turn it.
This feature's damage increases to 1d8+PROF at 6th level, 1d10+PROF at 10th level, and 1d12+PROF at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consumption of Despair
entries: You gain another way to regain Necrotic Charges:
Once per round, when at least three creatures take damage from Withering Aura before the start of your next turn, you can gain a Necrotic Charge.

subclassFeature.name: Rising Horror
entries: If a creature of size small or larger that you can see dies due to damage you've caused, you can use your reaction to infuse their energy into the Withering Aura. Until the end of your next turn, your Withering Aura counts as difficult terrain to hostile creatures and deals 1d6 necrotic, piercing, or poison damage (your choice) to hostile creatures moving into or through the area for every 5 feet they travel.

Once you have used this reaction, you can no longer do so unless you spend a Necrotic Charge to do so again, or finish a long rest. A Necrotic Charge can also be spent as a bonus action on subsequent turns to extend the duration of the effect by another turn.

subclassFeature.name: Malignant Armor
entries: Your curse enfolds you, skin and bone. At the start of each of your turns, roll 1d6. Until you roll this die again, you have a bonus to your AC equal to half the number rolled (rounded down), and a creature that hits you with a melee attack takes necrotic, piercing, or poison damage (your choice) equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Effluence of Death
entries: Through spreading your decay, you may empower your allies with unholy vitality. On your turn, as a reaction to a friendly creature within 30 feet being knocked unconscious you can expend any number of hit die and roll them. The creature gets 1 HP and an amount of temporary HP equal to the number rolled, not being knocked unconscious. While that creature has that temporary HP, their creature type is also Undead and they deal an additional 2d4 necrotic, piercing, or poison damage (your choice) on weapon attacks and unarmed strikes.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Beacon of the Tainted
entries: You have risen to be the apex of your Office, an exemplar of the decayed that leads hordes into damnation. You gain the following benefits:

items: The radius of Withering Aura increases to 20 feet. Office of the Tribute features ignore resistance to poison, necrotic, and piercing damage, and treat immunity as resistance.
You can reroll 1s on damage rolls for Office of the Tribute features an unlimited amount of times.

subclassFeature.name: Office of the Vampire
entries: Through exchanging blood with a Vampire, you are graced in ill luck to join their ranks. You may have been turned after a long seduction, or brutalised in battle by a fanged bite.

Vampires stand as the gilded peak of undead nobility - pursuing perfection in using their gifts as a singular elite. Vampires often float above or through the battlefield, seeking suitable challenges to test their skills as the champion of whoever they may be travelling with. You likely used your sanguine gifts - superhuman agility, attunement with the creatures of the night, and an unnatural force of personality - to dance through both the fields of war and Kindred politics.

At some point you sought to break away from the cycle of predation, to leave the stagnant hell of vampiric immortality behind for something greater. Yet for every privilege you have as a lord of the night, there is a pitfall. Each day sets your predatory desires against your new goals... And the pull of your instincts is a heavy yoke.

subclassFeature.name: Refined Tastes
entries: Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You add your constitution modifier instead of strength for its attack and damage rolls, and deals 1d8 piercing damage. Additionally, when you reduce a hostile creature to 0 HP, you can expend a necrotic charge to give an ally within 30ft a number of temporary hit points equal to a roll of your necrotic engine.
At level 6, the bite becomes magical.

subclassFeature.name: A Noble Creature
entries: One of the gifts of your vampiric nature is attunement to creatures of the night. Over the course of a minute in concentration, you may transform into a wolf or a rat, gaining its statistics. If your mental (INT, WIS, CHA) ability scores are higher than the chosen form, you retain your own of those ability scores. You don't have access to your Lictor features while transformed. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, but you can end it early (no action required), appearing in its space. If you take damage while transformed, you appear in that space in your normal form. At 8th level, you can also turn into a bat.

subclassFeature.name: Wrack Foes: Wrack with Obsession
entries: You enforce a challenge towards a foe with your unnatural charisma. Choose a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you: they must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take 3d4 psychic damage.
If they fail by 5 or more you gain half cover against the target until the start of your next turn.

Regardless of whether they succeed or not, they are now Challenged: They have disadvantage on attacks against targets other than you until the start of your next turn. You can now use Refined Tastes to grant your ally temporary HP as a reaction when the Challenged target dies while within 30ft of you.
This feature's damage increases by 1d4 at 6th level, 10th level, and 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consumption of Envy
entries: You gain a new way to regain Necrotic Charges:
Once per round when a hostile creature misses an attack roll against an ally by 5 or more, you may gain a necrotic charge.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Scion
entries: You have trained extensively to improve your martial skill: when you attack a creature while no creatures other than your target are within 5ft of you, you deal an additional 1d8 damage of the weapon's type. This occurs once per turn.
Additionally, you can briefly become incorporeal: you can cast {@spell Misty Step} as a bonus action by spending 2 necrotic charges.

subclassFeature.name: Nocturnal Champion
entries: While you have a creature Challenged, you gain half cover creatures that aren't your challenged target; Furthermore, whenever you spend a necrotic charge to deal necrotic damage you add an additional two die against the Challenged creature.

You have learned the sanguine gift of levitation: as a bonus action, you may give yourself flying speed equal to your current walking speed for 1 minute. This ability is usable proficiency bonus times per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Eclipse
entries: When you kill a Challenged creature on your turn, you can then Challenge another creature within 30 feet of you (no action required).
As an action you may darken the day as it flees your vampiric power. The area within 30 feet of you becomes dim light, and confers the following bonuses within the area:

items: Allies become immune to fear.

Enemies must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to your wrack save DC when starting their turn or entering this space for the first time during their turn, falling prone and becoming frightened of you until the end of their next turn. This effect does not work against your Challenged Target.
You reroll 1s on damage rolls against your Challenged target.

entries: This effect lasts for 1 minute. You may use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lord of the Night
entries: You have reached the apex of your office, becoming the ultimate vampiric elite. you gain the following benefits:

items: When you grant an ally temporary HP by spending a necrotic charge, you may target up to three allies within 30 feet of you.
You take (2x prof bonus) less damage from creatures that are not your challenged target. Your wracks ignore resistance to psychic or necrotic damage, and treat immunity as resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Office of the Wailer
entries: Although such tidings are difficult to prove, it is said that lichs, lords of the Shadowfell, and fiends mired in undeath all harbor a hatred of music. The positive energy of creation, used by skilled bards and found in the harmony of pure notes, is anathema to their ears. When the legions of the undead have reason to march to a rhythm, it is rung out with the same discord they spread to sow.

Wailers are the sound and fury of undeath, screeching out horrisonant calls to battle and ringing in each new recruit to the ranks of the dead with a mocking dirge. Banshees are frequently called to this office, but it is also reserved as an ironic position of enduring cruelty for those who trained as musicians in their prior life. Any such beings able to find freedom from their duties remain cursed to hear only irritation in true song, and can produce nothing but grating dissonance through any instrument.

subclassFeature.name: Wailing
entries: You can demoralize others by giving voice to the discordant negative energy reverberating through your body.

You can use a bonus action to start Wailing, which lasts for 1 minute. The sounds are audible up to 120 feet away, and can be heard on the Ethereal Plane. Your Wailing ends early if you are incapacitated, end your turn entirely within an area of sunlight, or are rendered unable to speak. You can also cease Wailing at any time (no action required).

While you are Wailing, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks and disadvantage on Charisma (Performance) checks. On the turn you begin Wailing and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns while your Wailing persists, you can choose one of the following effects to be active until the start of your next turn.

items: One creature within 30ft subtracts 1d4 from the first skill check, attack roll or saving throw it makes. This increases to 1d6 at 6th level, 1d8 at 10th level and 1d10 at 15th level.

Creatures of your choice within 20ft of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Wrack DC whenever they attempt to cast a spell. On a failure the spell is harmful to cast: they take necrotic damage equal to a Deathly Strike.
Creatures that end their movement within 5ft of you must make a Wisdom saving throw or immediately use their reaction to move half their speed away from you, without provoking attacks of opportunity.

entries: You can use this feature once, and cannot do so again until you complete a short rest or long rest, unless you expend a Necrotic Charge to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Gnashing of Teeth
entries: When a friendly creature within 30 feet of you that you can see or hear is hit with a critical attack, falls unconscious, or fails a saving throw , you can use your reaction to clash your teeth together in a bloodcurdling retort. When you do so, you have advantage on your next attack roll against a creature within 15 feet of you, provided the target could see or hear you when this reaction was used.

subclassFeature.name: Wrack Foes: Wrack with Noise
entries: You raise an unholy cacophony that overwhelms the senses of your foes. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10ft away from you. A creature that fails its save by 5 or more is also dazed until the end of your next turn. (A dazed creature can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action.)
This feature's damage increases to 4d8 at 6th level, 5d8 at 10th level, and 6d8 at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consumption of Discord
entries: You gain another way of regaining Necrotic Charges: Once per round, when a hostile creature fails a roll affected by Wailing, or fails a saving throw inflicted by Wailing, you may regain a necrotic charge.

subclassFeature.name: Death Rattle
entries: The thrill of deathly energy resonates within you, emerging as unearthly shivers of sound. At the start of your turn, you may expend one hit die to enhance the next Wrack you use during that turn: the Wrack deals an additional die of damage, and deals half damage on success if it didn't already. This benefit expires at the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Persephonic Orchestra
entries: Whenever you begin Wailing, friendly creatures within 20 feet of you that can hear you can choose to join you. Any creature that does so gains temporary hit points equal to your lictor level, and spreads its effects of your Wailing abilities to within 10 feet of itself while your Wailing continues. Additionally, your Wrack with Noise can originate from the location of a creature joining in.

subclassFeature.name: Crecendo of Despair
entries: You can imbue creatures with fatalistic energy, burning bright before the void. As an action, you can touch a willing creature (including yourself). For 1 minute, the creature is surrounded by wailing music and ghostly notes, granting the following benefits and drawbacks: The creature has +3 bonus to AC.
It has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. When the creature hits a target with a weapon attack or spell attack, the target takes an extra 1d8 thunder damage.

Damage rolls against the creature reroll 1s and 2s once. The effect ends early if the creature is knocked unconscious. When the effect ends, the creature immediately drops to 0 hit points and already has one failed death save. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Herald of Doom
entries: You have reached the apex of your office, becoming a calamitous harbinger of the End. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can target up to two creatures with the ability check / attack roll / saving throw reduction inflicted by Wailing at the same time.
Your Office of the Wailer features ignore resistance to thunder and necrotic damage, and treat immunity as resistance.
The radius of your Wailing while kept conscious by Unrelenting Animus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Necromancer Redux
entries: {@i This subclass was written by: @honeycombm}

{@i When playing in the Depths of Melokir campaign you may not Multiclass into or out of this class if you have selected this Subclass, nor can you select this Subclass if you are already Multiclassing}

entries.name: Necromancy Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy a necromancy spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Whispers from beyond
entries: At 2nd level, The souls of the lost and the damned occasionally whisper knowledge & secrets to aid you. When you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check, you can roll a d6 and add it to the result, potentially changing the result. You can add a die in this way a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
At 6th level, this die becomes a d8, at 10th level this die becomes a d10, and at 14th level this die becomes a d12.

subclassFeature.name: Seance
entries: At 6th level, you add the {@spell speak with dead} and {@spell augury} spells to your spellbook and they both count as necromancy wizard spells for you. Furthermore you may cast Augury twice between long rests instead of once before the spell begins to risk providing a random result.

entries.name: Friends on the Other Side
entries: You can now beseech the spirits you’ve contacted for aid in combat. If you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to call upon these spirits to supernaturally defend you or your ally, reducing that damage by 4d6.

Calling upon these spirits more than once a day may anger them, however. Each time you use this ability after the first in a single day, there is a cumulative 10 percent chance for the spirits to refuse to lend their aid (The reaction is still lost).

subclassFeature.name: Accustomed to the Macabre
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you have resistance to necrotic damage, and you become immune to the frightened condition. Furthermore, you are now immune to any effect that would lead to you being possessed, unless you allow it.

subclassFeature.name: Haunt Foe
entries: The spirits you interact with can aid you in combat in even more unnerving ways. Once per short rest, as an action, you can target a creature you can see within 60 ft feet of yourself and a spirit will begin haunting it. While the target is haunted, you can sense the direction and distance to the target if it is on the same plane of existence as you. Additionally, the target has disadvantage on all saving throws against your necromancy spells. The target remains haunted for 24 hours, until it dies, or until you use this feature on another creature.

subclassFeature.name: Thug
entries: {@i This subclass was written by: @maplecrepe}

{@i When playing in the Depths of Melokir campaign you may not Multiclass into or out of this class if you have selected this Subclass, nor can you select this Subclass if you are already Multiclassing}

You hone your skill in the less subtle aspects of being a rogue. You’re less worried about being hidden, and care more about making an impact on your foes. Bouncers and ruffians belong to this archetype.

entries.name: Streetsmarts
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in medium armour, shields, and improvised weapons. You also gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. If you already have proficiency in the Intimidation skill, you may choose another skill listed in the Rogue class. The damage dice for simple and improvised weapons, as well as your unarmed strikes increases to 1d6 if it was lower than that before.

entries.name: Dirty Tricks
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have a knack for dirty fighting. You may apply sneak attack to any simple melee weapon, improvised weapon, or unarmed strike. In addition, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to apply one of the following effects:

items.name: Shake ‘em down!
items.entry: The target of your attack must make a Dexterity saving throw or drop an object they are holding.

items.name: Spook ‘em!
items.entry: The target of your attack must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Grab ‘em!
items.entry: The target of your attack must make a Strength saving throw or be grappled by you.

entries: The saving throw DC for these effects equals 8 + PB + your Strength modifier.
You can benefit from these effects a number of times equal to 2 + your Strength modifier, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hired Muscle
entries: At 9th level, your experience with strong-arming people has taught you to hit even harder. The damage dice for your simple and improvised weapons, as well as your unarmed strikes increases to 1d8. In addition, you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gang Up
entries: At 13th level, you take any opportunity possible to deal some damage, kicking people when they’re down. When a creature within your reach is hit by an attack, you may use your reaction to make a melee attack against them. Your sneak attack feature does not apply to this attack, instead you roll ½ your sneak attack dice (rounded down) and add that to the damage of the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Thug's Mastery
entries: At 17th level, your dirty fighting becomes the dirtiest. When you use one of your Dirty Tricks features and deal sneak attack damage on the same attack, your Dirty Tricks features gain the following effects:

items.name: Shake ‘em down!
items.entry: A creature that dropped any item by this effect must use their action to pick it back up.

items.name: Spook ‘em!
items.entry: A creature frightened this way must use its next turn to run away from you.

items.name: Grab ‘em!
items.entry: A creature grappled this way is also restrained, and cannot cast spells with somatic or material components. To escape the grapple, they must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity check against your Dirty Tricks DC.

subclassFeature.name: Brute
entries: {@i This subclass was written by: @honeycombm}

{@i When playing in the Depths of Melokir campaign you may not Multiclass into or out of this class if you have selected this Subclass, nor can you select this Subclass if you are already Multiclassing}

entries.name: Bodyguard
entries: When an ally within 15 ft of you makes an intimidation check, they may add your strength modifier to the result.

entries.name: Brutal Cunning
entries: You harbor a reserve of pure brute force within yourself. This reserve is represented by your Brute dice, which are each a d6. You have a number of these dice equal to your 1 + your strength modifier, and they fuel various abilities you have, which are detailed below.

Some of your abilities expend a Brute die, and you can’t use an ability if it requires you to use a die when your dice are all expended. You regain all your expended Brute dice when you finish a short rest. In addition, you regain one expended Brute die when you use your second wind.
When you reach certain levels in this class, the size of your Brute dice increases: at 5th level (d8), 11th level (d10), and 17th level (d12). The abilities below use your Brute dice.

items.name: Brutal Strike
items.entry: Once on each of your turns, immediately after you hit a target with an attack and deal damage to it with a weapon using strength, you can expend one Brute die, rolling it and dealing additional damage to the target equal to the number rolled plus your Proficiency Bonus.

items.name: Brute force
items.entry: When you roll an Athletics or intimidation check, you may expend one Brute die, and add it to the roll.

items.name: That didn’t hurt one bit
items.entry: As a bonus action, you can expend one Brute die, rolling it and gaining temporary hit points equal to the roll of the die + your constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Brutal Defense
entries: You gain new defensive ways to use your Brute dice.

items.name: Brute constitution.
items.entry: When you roll a Constitution saving throw, you may expend one Brute die, and add it to the roll. If you still fail the saving throw, the Brute die is not expended.

items.name: Unstoppable
items.entry: When you roll a Death saving throw, you may expend one Brute die, and add it to the roll. If the result of your death saving throw is equal to or greater than 20, it is treated as if you had rolled a natural 20, and you regain 1 hit point.

items.name: Nice try
items.entry: You can use your reaction to expend one Brute die, when you are hit by a melee weapon attack, to lessen the blow. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by your Brute die + your strength modifier + your fighter level.

subclassFeature.name: Third Wind
entries: Third wind Once per long rest, when you are reduced below half your hit point maximum, you can regain all your expended Brute Dice.

entries.name: Go for the throat
entries: Your weapon attacks, that use strength, now score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Furthermore, you regain one Brute Die each time you roll a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Brutal Champion
entries: You can now use your Brutal strike more than once a turn.

subclassFeature.name: Too angry to die
entries: At the start of your turn, if you are below half your hit point maximum, but still have hit points, regain a number of hit points equal to 5+your constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Liberty
entries: {@i This subclass was written by: @ping.u}

{@i When playing in the Depths of Melokir campaign you may not Multiclass into or out of this class if you have selected this Subclass, nor can you select this Subclass if you are already Multiclassing}

Those who take the Oath of Liberty draw their power from the winds and the freedom they represent. They believe in the inherent right of all beings to live unburdened, unrestricted, and unrestrained. With a focus on breaking chains and upholding personal freedom, these paladins become agents of liberation, seeking to bring justice and equality to those oppressed by tyranny and injustice. Known as wind speakers, stormbound or grey knights, these paladins seek to liberate those from under the thumbs of the powerful.

entries.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

items.name: Whirlwind's Embrace.
items.entry: You can use your Channel Divinity to create a gale of swirling winds to stop your foes in their tracks. As an action, you can force each creature of your choice that you can see within 20 feet of you to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is knocked prone. This effect lasts 1 minute and each creature of your choice that ends its turn within the radius must make the saving throw or fall prone.

items.name: Breath of Deflection
items.entry: You can use your Channel Divinity to summon a protective gust of wind to shield an ally from harm. Immediately after a hostile creature within 30 feet of you hits with an attack against a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you may redirect the attack to a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you and within the triggering attack's range.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Liberty Spells
entries: You gain oath of liberty spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.name: Freedom Above All.
entries: There exists no greater existence than a life unfettered by chains. All souls should be free to chart their own path without the weight of oppression. Those who would wield their power to dominate others shall be smote by the tempest of justice.

entries.name: Whispers of the Zephyr.
entries: I place my trust in the guidance carried upon the gentle breeze. I heed the murmurs of the winds, the rumbling of gathering storms. Nature, the source of portent and council, grants me insight and wisdom in my pursuit of liberation.

entries.name: Unyielding Currents.
entries: I embrace the adaptive nature of the wind, forever shifting and finding its way past any obstacle. Like the ever-changing currents, I carve new paths and reveal hidden truths, unyielding in the face of adversity. To embrace the boundless flexibility of the storm is to stand prepared for any trial that obstructs the path to freedom.

entries.name: Into the Storm.
entries: The world is uncharted, brimming with secrets waiting to be revealed. Through the pursuit of these enigmatic quests, I unveil those who shroud their sinister deeds in shadows, ensuring they face rightful judgment. In this journey, I not only discover justice but also find the tempest's path to greatness.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Lethargy
entries: Starting at 7th level, the swirling currents of air around you hinder enemy movement. While you are not incapacitated, the area within 10 feet of you is difficult terrain for creatures of your choice.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Unrelenting Tempest
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain greater control over the winds and can call them to aid you. You can take the dash action or make a shove attack as a bonus action on each of your turns.
Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Primordial.

subclassFeature.name: Eye of the Storm
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of an intangible, unstoppable force of air. As an action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items.entry: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks and Dexterity saving throws.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Stone
entries: {@i This subclass was written by: @maplecrepe}

{@i When playing in the Depths of Melokir campaign you may not Multiclass into or out of this class if you have selected this Subclass, nor can you select this Subclass if you are already Multiclassing}

Druids of the Circle of Stone draw their power from stone and metal. Casting aside their aversion to metallic armour, these druids understand its purpose in the natural world. Members of the Circle of Stone act as stalwart guardians of nature, and their allies.

entries.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection to the spirits of the Elemental Plane of Earth grants you access to some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Circle of Stone Spells table.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Stone's Teachings
entries: At second level, you have learned how to use the materials granted to you by the earth. You gain proficiency in martial melee weapons. In addition, you may use armour and shields that are made of metal.

subclassFeature.name: Earthen Form
entries: As a bonus action, you may expend one use of your Wild Shape feature to reduce all bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage you take by ½ your druid level (instead of assuming a beast form)  for one minute, until you are incapacitated, or you dismiss it as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips that has a casting time of one action in place of one of those attacks if you have your Earthen Form feature active.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Earth
entries: At 10th level, you can command the earth to shield yourself and your allies. When you, or a creature you can see within 30ft of you is about to take damage, you may use your reaction to expend one spell slot to grant that creature a number of temporary hit points equal to twice the level of the spell slot plus your Wisdom modifier before they take the damage.

entries.name: Earthen Form Improvement
entries: Additionally at 10th level, while in your Earthen form, you gain the following features:

items.entry: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher with a casting time of 1 action, you may make a single melee weapon attack  as a bonus action that turn.
Once during each of your turns when you hit with an attack roll with a melee weapon, you can deal extra thunder damage to the target equal to your Wisdom modifier

subclassFeature.name: Metallic Bulwark
entries: At 14th level, you can use the forces of elemental Earth to better protect your allies. While in your Earthen Form, bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage an ally takes within 20ft of you is reduced by ½ your druid level.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Thrashing Monster
entries: {@i This subclass was written by: @dndhater}

{@i When playing in the Depths of Melokir campaign you may not Multiclass into or out of this class if you have selected this Subclass, nor can you select this Subclass if you are already Multiclassing}

At 3rd level, you gain the ability to affect those around you. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one or more of your attacks to create a special effect. You cannot replace more attacks than you have available and can only use this ability once per turn. The effect’s area is a sphere with a radius equal to the number of attacks you replace x 5 feet.

Each creature within that area must make a saving throw (the DC is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier), taking the effect’s damage on a failure or half as much on a success. Choose the nature of this effect from the following: the DC is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier:

items.name: Stomp
items.entry: The saving throw is Strength, the damage is 1d8 + Strength Modifier bludgeoning for every attack substituted, creatures not touching the ground automatically succeed, creatures who fail are knocked prone.

items.name: Roar
items.entry: The saving throw is Constitution, the damage is 1d6 + Strength Modifier thunder for every attack substituted, creatures who fail are deafened for a minute. Deafened creatures may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Clap
items.entry: The saving throw is Constitution, the damage is 1d8 + Strength Modifier damage bludgeoning for every attack substituted, creatures who fail are pushed 10 feet away and knocked prone. Requires two empty hands.

entries: (For example whilst using stomp and all available attacks. At 3rd level, this attack would deal 1d8 + STR damage, at 6th level the damage improves to 2d8 + STR*2, at 10th level this attack would deal 3d8 + STR*2, at 14th level this attack would deal 4d8 + STR*3).
Additionally, your jump distance is tripled.

subclassFeature.name: Directed Shock
entries: Beginning at 6th level, When you use Cry and Wreak Havoc, you may instead choose to make the effect a line coming from you that is 5 feet wide, as well as 15 feet long for every attack substituted. Additionally, when you use the effect of Cry and Wreak Havoc it counts as magical bludgeoning.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Rampage
entries: While raging, you may move through barriers created by spells such as wall of force or forcecage by hitting them with an attack (AC 10 + the spell’s level). Additionally your Cry and Wreak Havoc feature improves, the initial damage from Stomp & Clap increases by 1d8 and Roar increases by 1d6.
Additionally, your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Unbeatable Strength
entries: Whilst you are raging, when you use Cry and Wreak Havoc it is considered to have an additional attack added to it.

entries.name: Fathomless Rage
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you have a bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws equal to your Constitution Modifier (minimum of +0).

subclassFeature.name: Forge Adept
entries: {@i This subclass was originally published in: Exploring Eberron, And has been modified by @corronnicolla}
